40 // Simple macro to create a temperature selector type
41 #define TEMPERATURE_SELECTOR(__NAME__,__T__)\
42 class __NAME__\
43 {\
44 public:\
45  inline double getT(const Thermodynamics::StateModel* const state) const {\
46  return ( __T__ );\
47  }\
48 };
49 
51 TEMPERATURE_SELECTOR(TSelector, state->T())
52 
53 //TEMPERATURE_SELECTOR(TeSelector, std::min(state->Te(), 10000.0))
55 TEMPERATURE_SELECTOR(TeSelector, state->Te())
56 
58 TEMPERATURE_SELECTOR(ParkSelector, std::sqrt(state->T()*state->Tv()))
59 
60 #undef TEMPERATURE_SELECTOR
61 
63 typedef RateLawGroup1T<Arrhenius, TSelector> ArrheniusT;
64 
66 typedef RateLawGroup1T<Arrhenius, TeSelector> ArrheniusTe;
67 
69 typedef RateLawGroup1T<Arrhenius, ParkSelector> ArrheniusPark;
70 
71 //==============================================================================
72 
78 template <int Type>
79 struct RateSelector {
80  typedef ArrheniusT ForwardGroup;
81  typedef ArrheniusT ReverseGroup;
82 };
83 
84 #define SELECT_RATE_LAWS(__TYPE__,__FORWARD__,__REVERSE__)\
85 template <> struct RateSelector<__TYPE__> {\
86  typedef __FORWARD__ ForwardGroup;\
87  typedef __REVERSE__ ReverseGroup;\
88 };
89 
90 // Default rate law groups for non (kf(T), kb(T)) reaction types
91 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ASSOCIATIVE_IONIZATION, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusTe)
92 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(DISSOCIATIVE_RECOMBINATION, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusT)
93 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ASSOCIATIVE_DETACHMENT, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusTe)
94 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(DISSOCIATIVE_ATTACHMENT, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusT)
95 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(DISSOCIATION_E, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusTe)
96 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(RECOMBINATION_E, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusTe)
97 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(DISSOCIATION_M, ArrheniusPark, ArrheniusT)
98 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(RECOMBINATION_M, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusPark)
99 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(IONIZATION_E, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusT)
100 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ION_RECOMBINATION_E, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusTe)
101 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(IONIZATION_M, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusT)
102 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ION_RECOMBINATION_M, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusT)
103 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ELECTRONIC_ATTACHMENT_M, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusT)
104 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ELECTRONIC_DETACHMENT_M, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusTe)
105 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ELECTRONIC_ATTACHMENT_E, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusTe)
106 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(ELECTRONIC_DETACHMENT_E, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusTe)
107 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(EXCHANGE, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusT)
108 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(EXCITATION_M, ArrheniusT, ArrheniusT)
109 SELECT_RATE_LAWS(EXCITATION_E, ArrheniusTe, ArrheniusTe)
110 
111 #undef SELECT_RATE_LAWS

113 //==============================================================================
114 
115 RateManager::RateManager(size_t ns, const std::vector<Reaction>& reactions)
116  : m_ns(ns), m_nr(reactions.size()), mp_lnkf(NULL), mp_lnkb(NULL),
117  mp_gibbs(NULL)
118 {
119  // Add all of the reactions' rate coefficients to the manager
120  const size_t nr = reactions.size();
121  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_nr; ++i)
122  addReaction(i, reactions[i]);
123 
124  // Allocate storage in one block for both rate coefficient arrays and
125  // species gibbs free energies
126  const size_t block_size = 2*m_nr + ns;
127  mp_lnkf = new double [block_size];
128  mp_lnkb = mp_lnkf + m_nr;
129  mp_gibbs = mp_lnkb + m_nr;
130 
131  // Initialize the arrays to zero
132  std::fill(mp_lnkf, mp_lnkf+block_size, 0.0);
133 }
134 
135 //==============================================================================
136 
137 RateManager::~RateManager()
138 {
139  // Storage for lnkff and lnkfb were both allocated in mp_lnkff
140  if (mp_lnkf != NULL)
141  delete [] mp_lnkf;
142 }
143 
144 //==============================================================================
145 
146 void RateManager::addReaction(const size_t rxn, const Reaction& reaction)
147 {
148  // Get the rate law which is being used in this reaction
149  const RateLaw* p_rate = reaction.rateLaw();
150 
151  // Arrhenius reactions
152  if (typeid(*p_rate) == typeid(Arrhenius)) {
153  selectRate<MAX_REACTION_TYPES-1>(rxn, reaction);
154  } else {
155  throw InvalidInputError("rate law", typeid(*p_rate).name())
156  << "Rate law is not implemented in RateManager.";
157  }
158 }
159 
160 //==============================================================================
161 
162 template <int NReactionTypes>
163 void RateManager::selectRate(
164  const size_t rxn, const Reaction& reaction)
165 {
166  if (reaction.type() == NReactionTypes)
167  addRate<
168  typename RateSelector<NReactionTypes>::ForwardGroup,
169  typename RateSelector<NReactionTypes>::ReverseGroup>(
170  rxn, reaction);
171  else
172  selectRate<NReactionTypes-1>(rxn, reaction);
173 }
174 
175 template <>
176 void RateManager::selectRate<0>(
177  const size_t rxn, const Reaction& reaction)
178 {
179  addRate<
180  RateSelector<0>::ForwardGroup,
181  RateSelector<0>::ReverseGroup>(rxn, reaction);
182 }

186 template <typename T, typename U>
187 struct is_same {
188  enum { value = 0 };
189 };
190 
191 template <typename T>
192 struct is_same<T,T> {
193  enum { value = 1 };
194 };
195 
196 //==============================================================================
197 
198 template <typename ForwardGroup, typename ReverseGroup>
199 void RateManager::addRate(const size_t rxn, const Reaction& reaction)
200 {
201  m_rate_groups.addRateCoefficient<ForwardGroup>(rxn, reaction.rateLaw());
202 
203  if (reaction.isReversible()) {
204 
205  // Make use of forward computation when possible
206  if (is_same<ForwardGroup, ReverseGroup>::value)
207  m_to_copy.push_back(rxn);
208  else
209  // Evaluate at the reverse temperature
210  // note: mp_lnkff+(rxn+m_nr) = mp_lnkfb+rxn
211  m_rate_groups.addRateCoefficient<ReverseGroup>(
212  rxn+m_nr, reaction.rateLaw());
213 
214  m_rate_groups.addReaction<ReverseGroup>(rxn, reaction);
215 
216  } else {
217  m_irr.push_back(rxn);
218  }
219 }
220 
221 //==============================================================================
222 
223 void RateManager::update(const Thermodynamics::Thermodynamics& thermo)
224 {
225  // Evaluate all of the different rate coefficients
226  m_rate_groups.logOfRateCoefficients(thermo.state(), mp_lnkf);
227 
228  // Copy rate coefficients which are the same as one of the previously
229  // calculated ones
230  std::vector<size_t>::const_iterator iter = m_to_copy.begin();
231  for ( ; iter != m_to_copy.end(); ++iter) {
232  const size_t index = *iter;
233  mp_lnkb[index] = mp_lnkf[index];
234  }
235 
236  // Subtract lnkeq(Tb) rate constants from the lnkf(Tb) to get lnkb(Tb)
237  m_rate_groups.subtractLnKeq(thermo, mp_gibbs, mp_lnkb);
238 }
